revised_title: Effects of Atmospheric Oblateness and Diurnal Variation on Satellite Orbital Precession
tldr: The study investigates the effects of atmospheric oblateness and diurnal variation on the precession of satellite orbits. The research combines these factors into a single theoretical framework and determines the variation in the right ascension of the ascending node of the orbital plane. The findings are relevant to satellites in near-circular orbits at altitudes greater than the effects of both atmospheric oblateness and the diurnal variation are significant.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
